meta.title: Pittsburgh Help Finder
meta.subtitle: Quick help for housing, food, healthcare, and safety
notes: Information may change. If a phone number is busy or a shelter is full, try another option.
If this is a medical emergency, call 911.
If you feel unsafe or in crisis, call/text 988.

primary_contact.name: Allegheny Link (Coordinated Shelter Help)
primary_contact.short: Start here for shelter coordination. Families with children should call first.

items.name: Allegheny Link
items.summary: Best first call to access shelter placement and coordinated support.
items.details: Families with children are especially urged to call.

items.name: PA 2-1-1 (United Way)
items.summary: Helps find nearby food, housing, hygiene, and services by zip code.
items.details: Good for up-to-date schedules, pantry locations, and where to go today.

items.name: 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline
items.summary: For emotional crisis, feeling overwhelmed, or needing support right now.
items.details: Free, confidential. Connects to local resources.

items.name: re:solve Crisis Network
items.summary: 24/7 crisis hotline & mobile crisis team in Allegheny County.
items.details: Walk-in center available day or night for stabilization and support.

items.name: Second Avenue Commons (Low-Barrier)
items.summary: Low-barrier shelter open 24/7 with showers, laundry, storage, meals.
items.details: No curfew. Adds overflow beds in winter. Not for minors/families with children.

items.name: East End Cooperative Ministry (EECM) Shelter
items.summary: Nightly shelter with hot meal and safe place to sleep; walk-ins accepted.
items.details: Separate facilities for men and women. Handicap accessible.

items.name: McKeesport Downtown Housing (Mon Valley)
items.summary: Co-ed shelter with weekday intake. Severe weather shelter during cold nights.
items.details: Former YMCA facility. Handicap accessible.

items.name: Light of Life Rescue Mission (Men)
items.summary: Nightly shelter for adult men with dinner and breakfast.
items.details: Walk-ins may be allowed after roll call if space. Not handicap accessible.

items.name: Pleasant Valley Men’s Shelter (Northside Common Ministries)
items.hours: Call 10:00–11:00 AM to reserve; intake 3:00–4:30 PM
items.summary: Year-round nightly shelter for men with meals, showers, case management.
items.details: Handicap accessible.

items.name: Bethlehem Haven (Women)
items.summary: Emergency shelter for adult women with meals, health clinic, case management.
items.details: Handicap accessible.

items.name: Women’s Center & Shelter (Domestic Violence Safe Shelter)
items.summary: Emergency DV shelter with legal advocacy and counseling.
items.details: Location is confidential for safety. Call hotline anytime.

items.name: Womanspace East (Women w/ children)
items.summary: 30–60 day emergency shelter for women with dependent children.
items.details: Free of charge.

items.name: Genesis House (Pregnant women)
items.summary: Shelter for pregnant women with support services.
items.details: Not handicap accessible.

items.name: Salvation Army Family Caring Center
items.summary: Family shelter that accepts entire families, including fathers and couples.
items.details: Private family rooms, meals, and case management.

items.name: Family Promise of Southwestern PA
items.summary: Network-based shelter for families with meals and support toward housing.
items.details: No cost.

items.name: Familylinks Downtown Outreach (Youth Shelter 18–24)
items.summary: Emergency shelter for young adults with counseling and referrals.
items.details: Handicap accessible.

items.name: 412 Youth Zone (Drop-In + Housing Referrals 16–23)
items.summary: Drop-in center connecting youth to services and emergency housing help.
items.details: Operated by Auberle.

items.name: VA Homeless Care Line
items.summary: Connects veterans to local VA housing/shelter resources.
items.details: National call center.

items.name: Veterans Place (Drop-In + Transitional Housing)
items.summary: Drop-in center and transitional housing support for veterans.
items.details: Showers, laundry, food pantry, job help, and benefits support.

items.name: Shepherd’s Heart Veteran’s Home
items.summary: Transitional beds + case management and connection to services.
items.details: Also runs a morning drop-in program.

items.name: Second Avenue Commons Engagement Center
items.summary: Daytime drop-in: showers, laundry, Wi-Fi, computers, charging, case managers.
items.details: Free. You do not need to stay overnight to use the engagement center.

items.name: Wellspring Drop-In Center (Bethlehem Haven / Pittsburgh Mercy)
items.summary: Safe indoor space, lunch, coffee, peer support, referrals.
items.details: All are welcome; focus on mental health recovery.

items.name: Gift of Mary Women’s Day Center
items.summary: Women-only day center with showers, laundry, meals/snacks, hygiene items.
items.details: Walk-ins welcome during open hours.

items.name: Shepherd’s Place (Morning Drop-In)
items.summary: Morning drop-in with breakfast and basic services.
items.details: Free hot breakfast usually 7:30–8:30 AM.

items.name: Proud Haven (LGBTQ+ Youth Drop-In)
items.summary: Safe space, meals/snacks, hygiene supplies, referrals, housing support.
items.details: Call to confirm drop-in hours.

items.name: Jubilee Soup Kitchen
items.summary: Hot meals 7 days/week; place to sit and connect to services.
items.details: Serving time often ~11 AM–1 PM.

items.name: Red Door Lunch Distribution (St. Mary of Mercy Church)
items.summary: Bagged lunch distribution downtown.
items.details: No sign-up needed—just line up during distribution time.

items.name: Light of Life Mission Meals
items.summary: Serves breakfast and dinner daily to anyone.
items.details: No requirements; all are welcome.

items.name: EECM Community Kitchen
items.summary: Free hot weekday lunch in East Liberty.
items.details: Open to all.

items.name: Outreached Arms (First Presbyterian Church)
items.summary: Free dinner every Tuesday downtown.
items.details: No sign-up needed; show up.

items.name: Greater Pittsburgh Community Food Bank (Pantry Referrals)
items.summary: Directs you to the nearest food pantry by zip code.
items.details: Also try calling 2-1-1 for pantry referrals.

items.name: Catholic Charities Free Health Care Center (Medical + Dental)
items.summary: Free primary care + dental for uninsured/low-income individuals.
items.details: Call to schedule intake. Homeless individuals qualify.

items.name: Birmingham Free Clinic (UPMC/Pitt)
items.summary: Free clinic with rotating services; call to confirm walk-in times.
items.details: Often serves people without insurance and those experiencing homelessness.

items.name: Operation Safety Net (Street Medicine / Mobile Medical Unit)
items.summary: Medical outreach for people living outside or in shelters.
items.details: Can help with wounds, basic care, and connecting to services.

items.name: PA Get Help Now (Treatment Referral)
items.summary: 24/7 referral line for detox and treatment openings in Pennsylvania.
items.details: They help regardless of ability to pay.

items.name: Allegheny County Substance Use (OAS)
items.summary: Referrals to detox, medication-assisted treatment, recovery housing.

items.name: Prevention Point Pittsburgh (Harm Reduction)
items.summary: Free harm reduction services including naloxone, supplies, and some wound care.
items.details: Call or check schedule for mobile van locations.

items.name: AA Pittsburgh
items.summary: Find nearby Alcoholics Anonymous meetings.
items.details: Free and open to anyone seeking help.

items.name: NA Pittsburgh Helpline
items.summary: Find nearby Narcotics Anonymous meetings.
items.details: Free and open to anyone seeking help.

items.name: Carnegie Library (Downtown)
items.summary: Free entry, bathrooms, outlets, and Wi-Fi.
items.details: No library card needed to sit indoors or use restrooms.

items.name: Downtown Public Restroom (PGH Pit Stop)
items.address: Market Square / Forbes Ave area, Downtown
items.summary: Staffed public restroom and wash-up facility (when open).
items.details: Availability may vary.
